articles.author: Delfin Dioquino
articles.title: Gilas to start FIBA World Cup qualifiers with back-to-back games vs Korea - Rappler
articles.description: Gilas Pilipinas will tangle with Korea twice in the first window of the FIBA World Cup Asian Qualifiers in November
articles.content: Gilas then will face India and New Zealand again on June 30, 2022, and July 3, 2022, respectively, in the third window to wrap up the first round.

articles.author: danielw
articles.title: No exams, no tuition - will Chinese kids be stress-free? - The Straits Times
articles.description: China and India aim to reform its hyper-competitive education system. Asian Insider looks at how feasible the changes are.. Read more at straitstimes.com.
articles.content: As part of efforts aimed at relieving pressure on children and parents, China has announced a slew of measures such as banning exams for young kids and prohibiting private tuition as it looks to refo… [+2350 chars]

articles.title: Bus interchange clusters: Workplace transmission via "mask-off interactions" a likely source, says Kenneth Mak - The Online Citizen Asia
articles.description: The Online Citizen Asia Bus interchange clusters: Workplace transmission via "mask-off interactions" a likely source, says Kenneth Mak

articles.title: vivo named top 5G smartphone brand in Asia Pacific for 2021 2Q - manilastandard.net
articles.description: Leading smartphone brand vivo has been named the top 5G smartphone vendor in Asia Pacific for the second quarter of 2021 according to global market solutions company Strategy Analytics Inc.

articles.title: Park Seo-joon leaves South Korea to film in Marvel movie - AsiaOne
articles.description: Seems like the rumours are true and a K-drama bae is joining the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU). Back in June, it was reported that Park Seo-joon (star of Itaewon Class) was cast in The Marvels. However, Marvel Studios remained silent while Seo-joon's agency…
articles.content:

articles.title: Chinese team says quantum physics project moves radar closer to detecting stealth aircraft - AsiaOne
articles.description: Quantum particles in a man-made electromagnetic storm bounced back after hitting stealth object, increasing chance of detection, according to Tsinghua University team.
